response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund and repeal two existing conference center funds. [CHUNK_26] This measure establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_20] It repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and appropriates funds out of the new fund. [CHUNK_21] [CHUNK_22]",
  "appropriations": "There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs. [CHUNK_18] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. [CHUNK_19]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [CHUNK_24]",
  "agency_impact": "The Committee on Ways and Means received written comments in support of this measure from the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_26] Establishing a single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help to standardize conference center programs across all campuses of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_27] It will also facilitate the administration of conference center moneys. [CHUNK_27]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_24]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [CHUNK_7] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_12] A new section is added to chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_1] [CHUNK_2]",
  "revenue_sources": "The university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund is established for conference center programs conducted by the university. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund at the University of Hawaii at Hilo and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the new university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_16] [CHUNK_17]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_24]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The measure establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_2] The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [CHUNK_24]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_24]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The previous fiscal note was based on H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1. [CHUNK_25] This fiscal note is based on H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, which was amended by the Committee on Ways and Means. [CHUNK_29] [CHUNK_30] The committee amended the measure by clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_27] [CHUNK_28] The committee also made technical nonsubstantive amendments for purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [CHUNK_28]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [CHUNK_24]",
  "appropriations_changes": "The appropriation amount remains unspecified in the S.D. 2 version of the bill. [CHUNK_18] It appropriates the sum of $ (HB1169_SD2) for fiscal year 2025-2026. [CHUNK_18] This is consistent with the previous S.D. 1 version. [CHUNK_25]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the funding sources for this measure compared to the previous version. [CHUNK_24]",
  "department_impact": "The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure; the university of Hawaii remains the expending agency. [CHUNK_19]",
  "reports_required": "The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session. [CHUNK_6] This report must account for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_7]",
  "pilot_program": "The provided documents do not establish a pilot program. [CHUNK_24]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [CHUNK_24]",
  "effective_date": "This Act shall take effect upon its approval. [CHUNK_19] Section 5, relating to the appropriation, shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_19] [CHUNK_20]"
}

{
  "overview": "The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund and repeal two existing conference center funds. [CHUNK_26] This measure establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_20] It repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and appropriates funds out of the new fund.   "appropriations": "There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs. [CHUNK_18] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. [CHUNK_19]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [CHUNK_24]",
  "agency_impact": "The Committee on Ways and Means received written comments in support of this measure from the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_26] Establishing a single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help to standardize conference center programs across all campuses of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_27] It will also facilitate the administration of conference center moneys. [CHUNK_27]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_24]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [CHUNK_7] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_12] A new section is added to chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_1] [CHUNK_2]",
  "revenue_sources": "The university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund is established for conference center programs conducted by the university. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund at the University of Hawaii at Hilo and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the new university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_16] [CHUNK_17]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_24]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The measure establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, which was amended by the Committee on Ways and Means. [CHUNK_29] [CHUNK_30] The committee amended the measure by clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_27] [CHUNK_28] The committee also made technical nonsubstantive amendments for purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [CHUNK_28]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [CHUNK_24]",
  "appropriations_changes": "The appropriation amount remains unspecified in the S.D. 2 version of the bill. [CHUNK_18] It appropriates the sum of $ (HB1169_SD2) for fiscal year 2025-2026. [CHUNK_18] This is consistent with the previous S.D. 1 version. [CHUNK_25]",

  "department_impact": "The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure; the university of Hawaii remains the expending agency. [CHUNK_19]",

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB1169 SD2 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 1169 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 2 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised

THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new section to subpart D of part V to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " §304A- University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii

revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference

charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses

facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs,

conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section

related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session, accounting for all income and expenditures

of each regular session, accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" §304A-2272 Conference center revolving fund; University of Hawaii at Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference

There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with conference center programs shall be deposited in the revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or

The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or the chancellorꞌs designee is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for all costs associated with conferences, seminars, and courses provided by conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and

to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to chapter 103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall

The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session that includes an accounting for all income and expenditures of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273,

revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the community college conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys

the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center program of each community college shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The chancellor of each community college or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account

designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses by the conference center program, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per

rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, leis, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the

the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. "] SECTION 4. On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund

fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. SECTION 5. There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of

university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs. The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this

expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. SECTION 6. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 7. This Act shall take effect upon its approval; provided that section 5 shall take effect on July 1, 2025. Report Title:

5 shall take effect on July 1, 2025. Report Title: UH; Conference Center Revolving Fund; Appropriation Description: Establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System.

campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. Repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community

Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Appropriates funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. (SD2) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes
of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

SSCR1484 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1484 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 1169 H.D. 1 S.D. 2 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Ways and Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1,

Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving

is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund and repeal two existing conference center funds. Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the University of Hawaii System. Your Committee finds that establishing a single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help

single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help to standardize conference center programs across all campuses of the University of Hawaii System and facilitate the administration of conference center moneys. Your Committee has amended this measure by (1) Clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university

Clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund ; and (2) Making technical nonsubstantive amendments for purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached

of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Third Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169,

Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Ways and Means, ________________________________ DONOVAN M. DELA CRUZ, Chair

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.

HB1169_SD2_SSCR1484_.chunk_text: HB1169 SD2 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 1169 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 2 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised

THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new section to subpart D of part V to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " §304A- University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii

revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference

charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses

facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs,

conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section

related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session, accounting for all income and expenditures

of each regular session, accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" §304A-2272 Conference center revolving fund; University of Hawaii at Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference

There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with conference center programs shall be deposited in the revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or

The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or the chancellorꞌs designee is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for all costs associated with conferences, seminars, and courses provided by conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and

to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to chapter 103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall

The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session that includes an accounting for all income and expenditures of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273,

revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the community college conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys

the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center program of each community college shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The chancellor of each community college or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account

designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses by the conference center program, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per

rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, leis, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the

the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. "] SECTION 4. On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund

fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. SECTION 5. There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of

university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs. The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this

expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. SECTION 6. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 7. This Act shall take effect upon its approval; provided that section 5 shall take effect on July 1, 2025. Report Title:

5 shall take effect on July 1, 2025. Report Title: UH; Conference Center Revolving Fund; Appropriation Description: Establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System.

campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. Repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community

Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Appropriates funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. (SD2) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes
of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

SSCR1484 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1484 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 1169 H.D. 1 S.D. 2 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Ways and Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1,

Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving

is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund and repeal two existing conference center funds. Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the University of Hawaii System. Your Committee finds that establishing a single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help

single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help to standardize conference center programs across all campuses of the University of Hawaii System and facilitate the administration of conference center moneys. Your Committee has amended this measure by (1) Clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university

Clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund ; and (2) Making technical nonsubstantive amendments for purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached

of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Third Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169,

Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Ways and Means, ________________________________ DONOVAN M. DELA CRUZ, Chair
